content.en: Flow cytometry algorithms: Researchers are exploring the potential of algorithms to improve the analysis of flow cytometry data, which is used to study cells and their properties. These algorithms, such as the FIND platform and flowScape framework, provide automated and user-friendly environments for analyzing the data. They can emulate the human perspective, automate the identification of cell differentiation state, improve the sensitivity and specificity of single-cell analysis, and even detect cell properties without labeling. The algorithms also enable high-throughput analysis, single-cell sequencing, and phenotyping, as well as the identification of senescent cells and cell viability. Machine learning algorithms are being used to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of these analyses, without the need for pre-defined signal templates.
content.da: Flowcytometri-algoritmer: Forskere undersøger potentialet i algoritmer til at forbedre analysen af flowcytometri-data, som bruges til at studere celler og deres egenskaber. Disse algoritmer, såsom FIND-platformen og flowScape-rammen, tilbyder automatiserede og brugervenlige miljøer til dataanalyse. De kan efterligne det menneskelige perspektiv, automatisere identifikationen af celledifferentieringstilstand, forbedre sensitivitet og specificitet af enkeltcelleanalyse og endda detektere celleegenskaber uden mærkning. Algoritmerne muliggør også højgennemløbsanalyse, enkeltcelle-sekventering og fænotyping samt identifikation af senescente celler og cellelevedygtighed. Maskinlæringsalgoritmer bruges til at øge nøjagtigheden og effektiviteten af disse analyser uden behov for foruddefinerede signaltemplates.
